intro: Ambraria hirta var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from spring to summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the Verbenaceae family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments.
